summary.description: Enables glutaminyl-tRNA synthase (glutamine-hydrolyzing) activity. Involved in endoplasmic reticulum organization and glutaminyl-tRNAGln biosynthesis via transamidation. Located in mitochondrion. Part of glutamyl-tRNA(Gln) amidotransferase complex. Used to study cardiomyopathy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 40. Orthologous to human QRSL1 (glutaminyl-tRNA amidotransferase subunit QRSL1). [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Dec 2024]
